about.name: Delhi
about.info_text: Delhi, the capital of India, is a historic and dynamic city that blends a rich cultural heritage with modernity. With a history dating back centuries, Delhi is home to numerous monuments, bustling markets, diverse neighborhoods, and a vibrant street food scene. Visitors can explore ancient landmarks like the Red Fort and Qutub Minar, experience the spirituality of Lotus Temple, and savor the flavors of Indian cuisine. Delhi offers a unique blend of tradition and progress, making it a captivating destination for travelers.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 21.75 million
State: Delhi
Time Zone: Indian Standard Time (UTC+05:30)
Language: Hindi, English, and multiple regional languages
Currency: Indian Rupee (INR)
about.climate_text: Delhi experiences a diverse climate with hot summers, cool winters, and a monsoon season. Winters are the best time to visit, with comfortable temperatures for sightseeing.

attractions_card.title: Red Fort
attractions_card.description: The Red Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is a historic fort made of red sandstone and known for its stunning architecture and significance in India's history.

attractions_card.title: India Gate
attractions_card.description: India Gate is a war memorial and iconic landmark in Delhi, commemorating soldiers who lost their lives in World War I. It's a popular spot for picnics and evening strolls.

attractions_card.title: Qutub Minar
attractions_card.description: The Qutub Minar is a towering minaret and UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its intricate Islamic architecture and historical significance.

attractions_card.title: Lotus Temple
attractions_card.description: The Lotus Temple is a Bahá'í House of Worship with a distinctive lotus flower-shaped design. It's a place of worship and meditation open to all religions.

attractions_card.title: Humayun's Tomb
attractions_card.description: Humayun's Tomb is another UNESCO World Heritage Site, featuring a beautiful garden and Mughal architecture. It's often compared to the Taj Mahal.

attractions_card.title: Akshardham Temple
attractions_card.description: Akshardham Temple is a sprawling Hindu temple complex known for its stunning architecture, exhibitions, and cultural performances.

attractions_card.title: Chandni Chowk
attractions_card.description: Chandni Chowk is a historic market street in Old Delhi, offering a bustling shopping experience and a variety of street food stalls.

attractions_card.title: Jama Masjid
attractions_card.description: Jama Masjid is one of the largest mosques in India, featuring impressive Mughal architecture and a panoramic view from its minarets.

food_card.title: Biryani
food_card.description: Biryani is a popular Indian rice dish, often prepared with aromatic spices, saffron, and a choice of chicken, lamb, or vegetables.

food_card.title: Chole Bhature
food_card.description: Chole Bhature is a North Indian dish featuring spicy chickpea curry (chole) and deep-fried bread (bhature), often served with pickles.

food_card.title: Paratha
food_card.description: Paratha is a flatbread stuffed with various fillings like potato, paneer, or cauliflower, and is typically served with yogurt and pickles.

food_card.title: Pani Puri
food_card.description: Pani Puri is a popular street food consisting of hollow, crispy shells filled with spicy tamarind water, potatoes, and chickpeas.

food_card.title: Butter Chicken
food_card.description: Butter Chicken is a creamy and flavorful chicken dish in a tomato-based sauce, often enjoyed with naan or rice.

hotels_card.title: The Leela Palace New Delhi
hotels_card.description: The Leela Palace is a luxury hotel known for its opulent rooms, fine dining, and a royal ambiance.

hotels_card.title: The Imperial New Delhi
hotels_card.description: The Imperial is a historic and elegant hotel with a colonial-era charm, offering a comfortable and luxurious stay.

hotels_card.title: Taj Palace, New Delhi
hotels_card.description: The Taj Palace is a renowned hotel providing top-notch service, modern amenities, and beautiful garden views.

hotels_card.title: The Claridges, New Delhi
hotels_card.description: The Claridges is a boutique hotel with a blend of old-world charm and contemporary comforts, offering a unique stay experience.

hotels_card.title: The Oberoi, New Delhi
hotels_card.description: The Oberoi is a luxury hotel with well-appointed rooms and excellent dining options, perfect for a luxurious retreat.

transport_card.title: Delhi Metro
transport_card.description: The Delhi Metro is a modern and efficient way to navigate the city, with multiple lines connecting various parts of Delhi.

transport_card.title: Auto Rickshaws
transport_card.description: Auto rickshaws are a common mode of transportation for short distances within Delhi and are a part of the city's unique charm.

transport_card.title: Delhi Buses
transport_card.description: Public buses run by Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) provide an affordable means of travel throughout the city.

transport_card.title: Indira Gandhi International Airport
transport_card.description: Indira Gandhi International Airport (DEL) is the major international airport serving Delhi and is well-connected to both domestic and international destinations.
